message_1: Using Playfair cipher, if the keyword is "MATHS" and the plaintext is "HELLO WORLD", what is the resulting ciphertext?
message_2:
To encrypt the plaintext "HELLO WORLD" using the Playfair cipher with the keyword "MATHS", follow these steps:

1. Create the 5x5 Playfair matrix using the keyword "MATHS":
   M A T H S
   B C D E F
   G I K L N
   O P Q R U
   V W X Y Z
   (Note that I and J are combined into a single cell)

2. Split the plaintext into digraphs (pairs of letters) and adjust if needed:
   HE LL OW OR LD
   (No adjustment needed in this case)

3. Encrypt each digraph using the Playfair matrix:
   - HE: H (row 1) and E (row 2) are not in the same row or column, so replace them with the letters at the opposite corners of the rectangle they form: H -> C, E -> K
   - LL: L (row 3) and L (row 3) are in the same row, so shift each letter one position to the right (wrapping around): L -> N, L -> N
   - OW: O (row 4) and W (row 5) are not in the same row or column, so replace them with the letters at the opposite corners of the rectangle they form: O -> P, W -> V
   - OR: O (row 4) and R (row 4) are in the same row, so shift each letter one position to the right (wrapping around): O -> Q, R -> U
   - LD: L (row 3) and D (row 2) are not in the same row or column, so replace them with the letters at the opposite corners of the rectangle they form: L -> E, D -> G

4. Combine the encrypted digraphs to get the ciphertext:
   CK NN PV QU EG

So, the resulting ciphertext is "CKNNPVQUEG".
